intro: Helopus succinctus, commonly known as the smooth helopus, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are typically smooth and glossy. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, which are often borne on slender pedicels. Helopus succinctus is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and ease of cultivation. It prefers well-drained soil and partial to full shade, making it suitable for shaded garden environments.
